1.description: A tall, gangling youth with an Adam's apple and hands that he doesn't know what to do with. The sort of person who takes up two seats and leaves you wondering where the other one went.

3.description: Beginning to master the use of Death's sword and the supernatural abilities that come with his apprenticeship. Growing more confident in his role.

7.description: Becoming more powerful and taking on aspects of Death himself. His actions begin to have serious consequences for reality.

13.description: Has learned the true responsibilities and burdens of Death's role. Matured through his experiences and trials.

1.description: A seven-foot skeleton in a black robe who rides a pale horse named Binky. Speaks in CAPITAL LETTERS and has a curious fascination with humanity.

4.description: Becoming increasingly interested in what it means to be human. Taking a vacation from his duties to experience mortal life.

8.description: Working as a short-order cook, trying to understand human emotions and relationships while his apprentice handles his duties.

2.description: Death's adopted daughter, a young woman who has lived in Death's domain for years. Sharp-tongued and intelligent.

5.description: Growing fond of Mort despite his awkwardness. Knows more about Death's domain and duties than she initially lets on.

13.description: Has proven herself brave and resourceful. Ready to start a new life with Mort as a mortal.

2.description: Death's elderly manservant who cooks and maintains the domain. Has a mysterious past and seems to know more about magic than a servant should.

6.description: Revealed to be Alberto Malich, a former Archchancellor of Unseen University who achieved a form of immortality.

3.description: The young heir to the throne of Sto Lat. Scheduled to die in an assassination attempt but saved by Mort's intervention.

7.description: Caught between life and death due to Mort's intervention. Becoming translucent and existing in an altered reality.

12.description: Restored to full life and reality. Ready to take her place as a wise and just ruler.

4.description: A young wizard who serves as the court wizard of Sto Lat. Enthusiastic but not particularly powerful in magic.

8.description: One of the few people who can still see Princess Keli clearly. Works to help restore the proper reality.

1.description: Death's pale horse, actually a white stallion. Can gallop through the air and across dimensions.
Mort's father, a farmer who is at his wit's end about what to do with his awkward son.

3.description: The aging King of Sto Lat, Princess Keli's father. A practical ruler concerned about succession.
A scheming nobleman who plots to assassinate Princess Keli. Ambitious and ruthless.
The captain of Princess Keli's personal guard. Loyal and competent but mystified by recent events.

6.description: The current Archchancellor of Unseen University. Ambitious and concerned about magical disturbances.
Unseen University's librarian, transformed into an orangutan by magical accident. Highly protective of his books.

1.description: Lezek's wife and Mort's mother. Worried about her son's future prospects.

3.description: A professional killer hired to murder Princess Keli. Skilled but ultimately thwarted by supernatural intervention.
Partner to the first assassin in the plot against Princess Keli.

4.description: The head cook at the royal palace of Sto Lat. Concerned about the strange goings-on.
The chief administrator of the royal household. Trying to maintain order amid chaos.
The court doctor who is baffled by Princess Keli's condition and the strange events.

8.description: Owner of the tavern where Death works as a cook. Mystified by his strange new employee.
A regular customer at the tavern where Death works. Enjoys the new cook's unusual but excellent food.
A medium and fortune teller who senses the supernatural disturbances caused by Death's activities.

10.description: One of Death's colleagues, the anthropomorphic personification of War. A large, armored figure.
Another of Death's colleagues, representing hunger and want. Appears as a gaunt figure.
The third of Death's colleagues, embodying plague and disease. Works alongside the other horsemen.

11.description: A powerful supernatural entity who plays games with mortal lives. Concerned about the disruption to reality.

relationships.Opponent of: The Lady Who Must Not Be Named

the-lady.name: The Lady Who Must Not Be Named

11.description: A mysterious entity who represents chance and fortune. Plays cosmic games with Fate.

9.description: Leader of a monastery who has achieved a form of spiritual enlightenment. Wise and contemplative.
A monk at the mountain monastery. Part of the spiritual community that provides wisdom.
Another monk at the monastery, known for his meditative practices.
A practical monk who handles the monastery's construction needs.
An ancient monk who understands the nature of time and reality. Provides cryptic wisdom.

3.description: A palace guard loyal to Princess Keli. Honest and straightforward.
Another palace guard, somewhat less reliable than his colleagues.

4.description: The man in charge of the royal stables. Knowledgeable about horses and their care.
The official announcer for the royal court. Struggles with the changing reality.

8.description: A Watch captain in Ankh-Morpork who notices the strange disturbances in the city.
A sergeant in the Ankh-Morpork City Watch. Reliable but not the brightest.
A member of the City Watch with questionable personal hygiene and ethics.

6.description: A wizard at Unseen University who notices the magical disturbances affecting reality.
Another wizard at the University, concerned about the growing magical chaos.
A wizard known for his cowardice and bad luck, mentioned in passing at the University.
The Disc's first tourist, mentioned in University records as having caused various adventures.
The University's financial administrator, increasingly unstable due to magical stress.
A senior faculty member at Unseen University, pompous and self-important.
A faculty member who teaches about magical writing and symbols.
A professor of vague and uncertain magical subjects.

8.description: Leader of Ankh-Morpork's seamstresses, a respectable businesswoman.
A representative of the Thieves Guild, operating within legal parameters.
Head of the Assassins Guild, a refined gentleman who practices murder as an art.
A guard who patrols Ankh-Morpork's streets at night, witnessing strange events.

4.description: A trader who does business with the royal court of Sto Lat.

5.description: Owner of an inn in Sto Lat where travelers stay and gossip spreads.

4.description: The local blacksmith in Sto Lat who provides metalwork for the royal household.

5.description: A baker who supplies bread to both royal and common customers.

4.description: A local farmer who supplies produce to the royal kitchens.
A servant in the royal palace who helps care for Princess Keli.
Another palace maid who assists with royal household duties.
A kitchen servant responsible for cleaning dishes and assisting the cook.
A stable worker who cares for the royal horses and maintains equipment.
The palace gardener who maintains the royal grounds and gardens.
A nobleman at court who serves as an advisor to the king.
A noblewoman at court who serves as a companion to the royal family.

5.description: The chief religious official in Sto Lat who performs ceremonies and provides spiritual guidance.
A young priest who assists with religious ceremonies and duties.
The official who announces news and proclamations to the citizens of Sto Lat.
A trader who sells fish in the market and hears all the local gossip.

8.description: A street person in Ankh-Morpork who witnesses the strange supernatural events.

6.description: A young wizard studying at Unseen University, eager to learn about magic.
The doorkeeper at Unseen University who controls access to the magical institution.

11.description: A small personification of death who handles the demise of rodents and small creatures.
An even smaller personification who deals with the deaths of insects.

8.description: A stone gargoyle who comes to life and observes the city from his perch.

9.description: A zombie who maintains his identity and personality despite being undead.
A vampire who exists on the fringes of society, affected by the supernatural disturbances.
A spirit who haunts certain locations and is sensitive to changes in the supernatural order.
A banshee whose wailing announces deaths, confused by the supernatural chaos.

8.description: A troll who works as muscle for various enterprises in Ankh-Morpork.
A dwarf craftsman who works with metals and notices the strange magical disturbances.
A small humanoid who works in specialized trades requiring fine dexterity.
A regular at the tavern where Death works, enjoys the excellent food.
Another tavern customer who notices the strange new cook's abilities.
A large customer who is impressed by Death's cooking skills.
The tavern's serving girl who works alongside Death in the kitchen.
A young boy who helps wash dishes and clean the tavern.
An old man who cleans the streets and witnesses supernatural events.
A mystic who reads palms and cards, sensitive to supernatural disturbances.
A bureaucrat who handles city records and notices discrepancies.
A craftsman who makes and repairs shoes for city residents.
A merchant who deals in fabrics and notices the economic effects of supernatural events.

5.description: A skilled craftsman who creates jewelry for wealthy customers.

9.description: A wise woman who deals in herbs and potions, sensitive to magical disturbances.

4.description: A craftsman who works with wood and construction.
Operates the grain mill that supplies flour to the town.
Provides meat to both common folk and the royal household.
Creates various cheeses and dairy products for the local market.

5.description: Brews beer and ale for taverns and private customers.
Produces candles and other lighting supplies for the community.
Creates textiles and clothing from various fibers.
Creates pottery and ceramic goods for household use.
Produces ropes and cords for various uses around town.
Deals in salt and other preservatives essential for food storage.
Imports and sells rare spices and exotic ingredients.
Specializes in fine wines and spirits for discerning customers.
Provides various oils for lamps, cooking, and other household needs.
Maintains beehives and sells honey and beeswax products.

4.description: Raises chickens and other poultry, selling eggs and birds.

5.description: Grows and sells medicinal and culinary herbs.

4.description: Tends fruit trees and sells seasonal produce.
Grows vegetables and root crops for the local market.
Grows various grains and cereals for processing into flour.
Raises sheep for wool and meat, important to the local economy.
Raises cattle for milk and meat production.
Raises pigs for meat and uses every part of the animal.
Keeps goats for milk, meat, and hide production.
Buys and sells horses for transportation and farm work.
Uses oxen for heavy farm work and transportation of goods.
Uses donkeys for carrying loads and transportation in rough terrain.

5.description: Carries messages between towns and important locations.

6.description: Creates maps and charts for travelers and traders.

5.description: Writes letters and documents for those who cannot read or write.
Keeps financial records for businesses and wealthy individuals.
Exchanges currencies and provides banking services.

8.description: Provides insurance against various risks and disasters.
Provides loans and financial services to those in need of capital.

5.description: Collects taxes and fees for the royal government.
Controls the flow of goods across borders and collects duties.

6.description: Presides over legal proceedings and makes judicial decisions.
Provides legal representation and advice to clients.
Manages prisoners and maintains the local jail facility.

7.description: Carries out capital punishment sentences ordered by the court.

5.description: Patrols the town and maintains order among the citizens.

8.description: Responds to fires and other emergencies in the city.
Collects and disposes of human waste and garbage from the city.
Specializes in eliminating rats and other vermin from buildings.
Cleans chimneys and flues to prevent fires and improve air flow.
Lights and maintains the street lamps throughout the city.

4.description: Delivers fresh water to homes and businesses without wells.

5.description: Harvests and sells ice for food preservation and cooling.

9.description: Handles funeral arrangements and burial services for the deceased.
Digs graves and maintains the cemetery grounds.

5.description: Grows and sells flowers for celebrations and ceremonies.
A traveling musician who performs in taverns and at celebrations.
An old man who recounts stories and legends to anyone who will listen.
A skilled performer who juggles and entertains crowds at markets.
An agile performer who does flips and tricks for entertainment.
A dangerous performer who eats fire and breathes flames for spectacle.
A performer who operates marionettes and hand puppets for children.

8.description: A performer who acts out scenes without speaking, using only movement.
Creates small cakes with fortunes inside for those seeking guidance.

recaps.1: Mort, a gangly farm boy, is apprenticed to Death himself at a hiring fair. Death takes him to his supernatural domain to begin learning the trade of collecting souls.
recaps.2: Mort meets Death's adopted daughter Ysabell and the mysterious servant Albert. He begins to learn about Death's domain and the responsibilities of being Death's apprentice.
recaps.3: Death sends Mort on his first solo mission to collect the soul of Princess Keli of Sto Lat, but Mort interferes and prevents her assassination, disrupting the natural order.
recaps.4: The consequences of Mort's intervention begin to manifest as reality becomes unstable. Princess Keli exists in a liminal state between life and death, noticed by few.
recaps.5: Death decides to experience mortal life and takes a job as a cook while Mort continues his duties. The reality distortions grow worse as Princess Keli becomes increasingly translucent.
recaps.6: Cutwell the wizard and others who can still see Princess Keli try to help stabilize her existence. The wizards at Unseen University begin to notice magical disturbances.
recaps.7: Mort's feelings for Princess Keli complicate matters as he struggles with his growing powers and the mounting consequences of his earlier intervention in her fate.
recaps.8: Death enjoys his experience as a mortal cook, discovering human emotions and relationships. Meanwhile, the supernatural disturbances affect creatures throughout the city.
recaps.9: The disruption to reality reaches critical levels. Supernatural beings and undead creatures are affected by the chaos as the natural order continues to unravel.
recaps.10: Death's fellow personifications - War, Famine, and Pestilence - become concerned about the disruption. The monks at their mountain monastery sense the temporal disturbances.
recaps.11: Fate and other cosmic entities take notice of the reality crisis. The anthropomorphic personifications meet to discuss the growing threat to the natural order of things.
recaps.12: The climax approaches as Death must choose between his newfound appreciation for mortality and his cosmic responsibilities. The reality distortions threaten everything.
recaps.13: Death confronts the consequences of the reality disruption and works to restore the natural order. Mort learns important lessons about duty, love, and the nature of death itself.
